page.title: 13WORDS WE USE
page.content: When we are talking to our friends, we use a lot of words which most children understand but adults do not use. Here are some of the words and their meanings with a sentence to show how we would use them. {ADJECTIVES {ace}- first class {barrie}- very good {gen}- excellent {manky}- filthy {pimps}- easy,simple{satch}- easy {shan}- sneaky 'That was an {ace }goal,' said Peter. Moira thought the pizza was{barrie. When she saw him do a triple-pike jump she exclaimed{'gen'! When Paul slipped in the mud, his clothes were {manky.} The English exercise was {pimps.} The strong man found it{satch}to lift the book. Mary was{shan}to hit the boy as he was smaller than she was.
